question: What is the name of the continent on which most of the action of "Game of Thrones" takes place?

Aside from being Master of Coin and a member of the King's Small Council, the character of Peter "Littlefinger" Baelish from King's Landing also runs what kind of business?
What is the name of Arya Stark's sword?

Which position on the king's small council is his closest adviser and has the power to make decisions in the king's absence?
For what reason was Hand of the King Eddard (Ned) Stark executed?
correctAnswer: Challenging Joffrey's right to be king

question: Daenerys Targaryen has three children. These "children" are actually what?
It was Jon Arryn's sudden death that brought Ned Stark to King's Landing, where he sought the truth behind Lord Arryn's demise. Who actually killed Robert's first "Hand of the King?"
What nasty creature felled a drunken King Robert?

Sansa Stark and Tyrion Lannister were suspected of poisoning King Joffrey. Who, however, really did the little monster in?
Each night before sleep Arya Stark speaks the names of those she wishes dead. Who wasn't on little Arya's original "hit list?"

If the Night's Watch is a brotherhood, Jon Snow is guilty of serial fratricide. Who amongst these black brothers was not slain by "Lord Snow?"
Oberyn Martell died championing Tyrion Lannister in a "trial by combat." By what nickname was his killer known?

In season 2, who does Tyrion tell Varys he is planning on marrying to Princess Myrcella?
Which of the following characters DOES appear in season 1?
Who attempts to kill Tyrion on the battlefield in the Battle of Blackwater Bay?
Which of the following types of wine does the wine merchant attempt to poison Daenerys with?
What is Daenerys' response to Kraznys mo Nakloz after he tells Missandei to tell Daenerys that her "beast won't come" to him after the exchange of Drogon for the army of Unsullied?
What is the first thing Jon Snow says in the first episode in season 4?
correctAnswer: "Last time I saw him, he was in the courtyard at Winterfell".

question: What is the name of the man that Arya kills in season 4 after he tries to kill The Hound due to the bounty on The Hound's head?
